alert.note: Alert for Bell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 6:38AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bell County through 715 AM CST... At 637 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Briggs, or 11 miles northeast of Bertram, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Killeen, Temple, Copperas Cove, Harker Heights, Belton, Fort Hood, Nolanville, Morgan`s Point Resort, Salado and Little River-Academy. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 277 and 301. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flooding, especially across the Killeen and Temple areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
